newsitem.title: BULGARIA: BULGARIA ELIMINATES FOOT-AND-MOUTH DISEASE OUTBREAK.
newsitem.headline: BULGARIA ELIMINATES FOOT-AND-MOUTH DISEASE OUTBREAK.

text.p: Bulgaria's southern regional veterinary service announced that a foot-and-mouth disease outbreak in the southeastern village of Malko Sharkovo was over, the official news agency BTA said on Monday.
"The ban on livestock transport, trade and hunting in region was lifted as the foot-and-mouth disease outbreak is terminated," said the agency.
Bulgaria suspended livestock exports and trade two weeks ago in a bid to contain the outbreak in Malko Sharkovo, near the southern town of Yambol.
Some 15 million levs were allocated to compensate losses suffered by local farmers by the disease.
Last week Romania temporarily banned livestock imports its southern neighbour following the outbreak.
Bulgaria last had an outbreak of the disease in 1993 and no foot-and-mouth cases have been reported since then.

Earlier in the year Bulgaria banned imports of meat and dairy products from Greece, Turkey, rump Yugoslavia and Macedonia and withdrew its herds from the border areas, as part of precautionary measures to forestall the spread of the disease.
